instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video issue
threads.message:
I got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is not posting video. At first it did post video so i ran asd  os 3s150, after about 3 min no more video, machine is still running but no video. Shut it down and rebooted to asd EFI 3s150 it got almost to the memory test and boom no video but still running. I was thinking maybe a bad <SIGNAL>LCD_EN</SIGNAL> resistor is going out. i check and sure enough no <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> on pin 1 of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. check the resistor <RESISTOR>R9010</RESISTOR> and and get 10kohms checked for power at pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R9126</RESISTOR>(well at least at the pad being that there isn't a resistor there) and no voltage(0.0v). i also checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> had 3.44v.

any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video issue
threads.message: Probably bad GPU, take to Apple for a free fix.
